intro: Napoleonaea cuspidata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant, though it is also found in the wild in humid, shaded environments.
